Cuerpo: Discrete Math (CSC 222) is strongly recommended. Errata for the textbook, instructor's notes for selected topics, and other materials are on reserve in D.H. Hill Library and/or accessible from the class WWW page. Opportunities to earn extra credit are unlikely, and, if available, will be offered to all students on the same basis. Drop Date: October 25. Homework problem sets will be assigned on a regular basis. Model solutions will be made available on specified due dates. is to be prepared for exams; no explicit credit will be given for homework. (If available TA resources permit, some problem sets will be collected and selected problems will be read and commented upon.) 2, Sec. 31.2, Sec. 4; HW1 due 9/3 Quicksort;   Sec. 7, Sec. 9.1; HW2 due 9/12 Linear-time Sorts;  Sec. 18.1-3 9/19 Review; HW3 due 9/24 Exam 1 Last year's exam 9/26 Binomial & Fibonacci Heaps;   Sec. 20, Sec. 21 10/1  Disjoint Sets;  Sec. 23.1; HW4 due 10/8 Depth- and Breadth-First Search;   Sec. 17 10/29 Review; HW5,HW6 due; 10/31 Exam 2 Last year's exam 11/5 P and NP;  Sec. 37; HW7 due 11/19 Dynamic Programming;   Sec. 35; HW8 due 12/5 Review; HW9 due 12/10 Final Exam, 8:00-11:00 Last year's final (closed-book) dwyer@csc.ncsu.edu Rex Dwyer updated 8/20/96
